unified_data.price: Coursera offers Specializations as a subscription; prices vary, but typically range from $49 to $79 per month.

original_data.Title: Guitar for Beginners
original_data.Short Intro: Grasp the essentials needed to begin playing acoustic or electric guitar. You'll learn an easy approach to get you playing quickly, through a combination of exploring the instrument, performance technique, and basic music theory.

original_data.Title: Guitar Performance Techniques
original_data.Short Intro: Your favorite guitarist didn't become your favorite guitarist without the support of other musicians. The most important skill for a guitarist to learn is the exact same skill that was so important in kindergarten: playing well with others. Guitar Performance Techniques gives guitarists the essential and practical skills to play well with others in any ensemble situation. This course begins with daily warm-up techniques that help you prepare for rehearsals, jam sessions, and stage performances. From there, you'll explore chords, time accuracy, tone production, ear training, and the many aspects of jamming with other musicians. Upon successful completion of this course, you will be able to confidently interact with other musicians in a group setting and bring your A-game to any jam session you join.

unified_data.learning_outcomes: Develop essential skills to play effectively in ensembles. Learn warm-up techniques, improve time accuracy, tone production, ear training, and confidently interact with musicians in jam sessions or rehearsals.
unified_data.price: Free to audit. Paid certificate available.

original_data.Title: Guitar Scales and Chord Progressions
original_data.Short Intro: You’ve got the guitar basics down: You can strum your guitar and play a few of your favorite songs, but you’re ready to take the tunes to the next level. In Guitar Scales and Chord Progressions you’ll expand your knowledge of scales, chord fingerings, and common chord progressions. You’ll also learn important skills for soloing, creating melodies, and adding depth and dimension to your guitar playing.
original_data.Subtitle Languages: Subtitles: French, Portuguese (European), Russian, English, Spanish

unified_data.title: Guitar Scales and Chord Progressions
unified_data.description: You’ve got the guitar basics down: You can strum your guitar and play a few of your favorite songs, but you’re ready to take the tunes to the next level. In Guitar Scales and Chord Progressions you’ll expand your knowledge of scales, chord fingerings, and common chord progressions. You’ll also learn important skills for soloing, creating melodies, and adding depth and dimension to your guitar playing.
unified_data.prerequisites: Basic guitar playing skills, familiarity with basic chords and strumming patterns.
unified_data.learning_outcomes: Expand knowledge of scales and chord fingerings; master common chord progressions; develop skills in soloing and melody creation; add depth to guitar playing.
unified_data.price: Coursera offers courses with a free audit option or a paid subscription for full access and certification.

original_data.Title: Guitar Chord Voicings: Playing Up The Neck
original_data.Short Intro: Many beginning guitarists have learned the basics of open and movable chord shapes, but want to further expand this chord knowledge. In this course you’ll learn how to construct and play triads and basic 7th chords. You’ll start by creating major and minor triad inversions, and move on to power chords, drop-2 voicings, and learn how to substitute common chords to create a richer harmonic experience for listeners. Throughout the course, you will focus on the notes that chords are made up of, rather than the shape of individual chords. With this knowledge, you will be able to create inversions and different chord voicings up and down, and across the entire fretboard of the guitar, thus unlocking new ways of playing the guitar.

unified_data.title: Guitar Chord Voicings: Playing Up The Neck

You’ll start by creating major and minor triad inversions, and move on to power chords, drop-2 voicings, and learn how to substitute common chords to create a richer harmonic experience for listeners. Throughout the course, you will focus on the notes that chords are made up of, rather than the shape of individual chords. With this knowledge, you will be able to create inversions and different chord voicings up and down, and across the entire fretboard of the guitar, thus unlocking new ways of playing the guitar.
unified_data.prerequisites: Basic guitar playing skills, familiarity with open and movable chord shapes.
unified_data.learning_outcomes: Construct and play triads and basic 7th chords, create major and minor triad inversions and drop-2 voicings. Learn to substitute common chords for richer harmonies and create chord voicings across the fretboard.
unified_data.price: Coursera offers free enrollment with limited access, or a paid subscription for full access and certification.
